item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition announced, now available
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Physical edition due out on April 16.

Publisher Nintendo and developer Monolith Soft have announced Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition. It is available now via Nintendo eShop. Users who own the Switch version can upgrade by purchasing the “Upgrade Pack.” A physical edition will launch on April 16.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Edition features a faster frame rate of up to 60 frames per second, as well as enhanced resolution up to 4K.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road third free major update ‘Orion & Lumen DLC’ launches February 25
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

The Football Frontier International awaits.

LEVEL-5 will release Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road‘s third free major update, “Orion & Lumen DLC,” on February 25, the company announced.

The announcement reads: “The next grand stage awaits Sonny Wright (Asuto Inamori) and his friends: the Football Frontier International! But mysterious footballers known as the Disciples of Orion are looming on the horizon…”

Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

Free Major Update “Orion & Lumen DLC” Trailer

English

Japanese

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 2/9/26 – 2/15/26
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties debuts at 94,004 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of February 9, 2026 to February 15, 2026.

Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties was the highest selling new release of the week, opening at 58,171 units on PlayStation 5, 19,845 units on PlayStation 4, and 15,988 units on Switch 2 for an opening week total of 94,004 retail copies sold.

Mario Tennis Fever for Switch 2 followed at 39,522 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 57,779 units, the Switch family sold 26.481 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 11.588 units, the Xbox Series family sold 755 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 25 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [PS5] Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (SEGA, 02/12/26) – 58,171 (New)
  2. [SW2] Mario Tennis Fever (Nintendo, 02/12/26) – 39,522 (New)
  3. [NSW] Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Square Enix, 02/05/26) – 32,102 (209,665)
  4. [SW2] Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Square Enix, 02/05/26) – 23,617 (183,718)
  5. [PS4] Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (SEGA, 02/12/26) – 19,845 (New)
  6. [SW2] Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties (SEGA, 02/12/26) – 15,988 (New)
  7. [PS5] Dragon Quest VII Reimagined (Square Enix, 02/05/26) – 11,800 (130,598)
  8. [PS5] Nioh 3 (Koei Tecmo, 02/06/26) – 9,702 (50,272)
  9. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 9,473 (2,825,494)
  10. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 7,265 (8,377,788)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on February 20.

  1. [PS5] BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X (Astrolabe Games, 02/12/26) – (New)
  2. [NSW] BlazBlue: Entropy Effect X (Astrolabe Games, 02/12/26) – (New)
  3. [PS5] Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (Marvelous, 02/13/26) – (New)
  4. [PS5] REANIMAL (THQ Nordic, 02/13/26) – (New)
  5. [SW2] Animal Crossing: New Horizons – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 01/15/26) –
  6. [SW2] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Konami, 11/13/25) –
  7. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) –

  10. [NSW] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen (Konami, 11/13/25) –

Hardware Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. Switch 2 – 57,779 (4,430,672)
  2. Switch OLED Model – 20,226 (9,453,080)
  3. PlayStation 5 Digital Edition – 6,341 (1,184,279)
  4. Switch Lite – 4,882 (6,858,772)
  5. PlayStation 5 – 3,562 (5,891,412)
